results.title: Little echo lost
results.creator_credit: Armagan Ballantyne, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The EchoMan has never questioned his existence till now. One day he witnesses an event that brings into question everything he stands for and believes in. Stars Hugo Weaving as the EchoMan and Alana de Roma as the young girl. Original format 35mm.

results.title: Little Dorrit
results.creator_credit: Sands Film (Dorrit), John Brabourne, Richard Goodwin and Christine Edzard
results.brief_description: Set in the 1820’s, Charles Dickens’ Little Dorrit centres upon Arthur Clennam and Amy Dorrit who find love and happiness within Dickens’ restrictive environment. Part 1: Nobody’s Fault. Arthur is a kind but ineffectual man, bankrupt through speculation and in debtors prison where he encounters Amy whose story is told in Part 2: Little Dorrit’s Story. Amy is a tough clear headed seamstress, cheerfully supporting her imprisoned father. Amy works for Arthur’s mother whom she discovers has been denying Arthur’s rightful inheritance. When her father is released from goal, a twist of fate reunites Amy with her gentle admirer and his fortune. Stars Alec Guiness, Derek Jacobi, Joan Greenwood, Roshan Seth, Cyril Cusak and Sarah Pickering as Little Dorrit.

results.title: Little Caesar
results.creator_credit: First National Pictures, Hal B Wallis and Mervyn LeRoy
results.brief_description: ‘Little Caesar’ made Edward G.Robinson a star and exemplified the 1930’s gangster movie. Robinson plays “little tough guy” Caesar Enrico Bandello, whom with his cohort Joe Massara played by Douglas Fairbanks Jr., head for the big city in pursuit of power and wealth. His ruthlessness sees him climb to the top over his rivals, but success is short-lived in a world filled with violence and corruption. Mervyn Le Roy hired three mobsters as advisors and the film’s authenticity is a testimony to his attention to detail and fascination for the subject matter.

results.title: Little By little: upgrading Barrio Escopa
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Tina Viljoen
results.brief_description: In Manila, nearly one million people live in squatter settlements; living conditions vary from almost pleasant to appalling. Little by Little documents the attempt to upgrade a section of one such settlement, Barrio Escopa. The project takes all aspects of community life into account. The film examines the complex nature of urban redevelopment and the roles played by different government agencies in the project’s execution.

results.title: Little Burgundy = La P'tite Bourgogne
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Forget, George C. Stoney, Bonnie Sherr Klein and Maurice Bulbulian
results.brief_description: When an old area of a city is to be demolished to make way for a new low-rental housing development, is there anything that the residents can do to protect their own interests? This film, produced in 1968, airs such a situation in the Little Burgundy district of Montreal. It shows how citizens organized themselves into a committee that made effective representations to City Hall and influenced the housing policy.

results.title: Little Britain. The Complete first series
results.creator_credit: BBC, Myfanwy Moore and Steve Bendelack
results.brief_description: Little Britain as seen on ABC television is a surreal comedy featuring lunatics, misfits, teenage delinquents and bad transvestites. The BAFTA award winning series was written and performed by Matt Lucas and David Williams who’s range of the grotesque and, at the same time, everyday characters are set to surprise. Funny and perverse. Narrated by Tom Baker.

results.title: Little boy lost
results.creator_credit: Summit International, Alan Spires and Terry Bourke
results.brief_description: Based on an event that occurred in the township of Guyra, NSW, in 1960, this video is dedicated to the volunteers involved in the search for four year old Stephen Walls. Stephen disappeared whilst watching his father sheep herding. Initially it’s the police and local farmers who begin the search, but as night falls and it becomes evident Stephen may not be found, hundreds of locals join in. By the third day volunteers have spilled beyond the confines of the local community as interstate army brigades and other services are supplied. Stephen is eventually found after four days and three nights, in good health. This film highlight the dedication of the volunteers and the faith of Jacko and Dorrie Walls that their son would return to them safely. Starring John Hargreaves, Lorna Lesley, Tony Elliot and Nathan Dawes as Stephen Walls. Adapted from a storyline by John Powell and Suzanne Turner.

results.title: Little blocks
results.creator_credit: Education Development Center Film Studios and John Friedman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Exploring Childhood”.
Portrays an adolescent working with preschoolers. However the adolescent dominates all play activities until the child becomes disinterested. Shows the nonverbal clues given by the child which are ignored by the adolescent.

results.title: Little big top
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Torben Schioler, Tony Ianzelo, Bill Brind, Colin Low and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the magic generated by the Royal Brothers’ Circus, a tent circus of a type that is fast disappearing. Torrential rains, axles sunk in mud, shaky performances, and a monumental tent that must be pulled up and down once a day do not inhibit the fifteen trucks and assorted beasts from travelling around at a rate of one town a day.
